    DevCon 2025 Troubleshooting

    Last updated on 2025-04-22 | Edit this page

    üíß NGIAB-CloudInfra ‚Äì DevCon 2025 Workshop Setup Guide

    Welcome to the NGIAB Workshop!
    This guide will help you install everything, run the model, and troubleshoot problems ‚Äî no technical background required.

    üì¶ NGIAB stands for NextGen In A Box ‚Äì a simplified way to run the NextGen National Water Model on your local computer using Docker.

    Organized and supported by Arpita Patel and the NGIAB team.

    üíª 1. Pre-Setup Requirements

    ‚úâÔ∏è Note: You will be provided with a cloud instance (Jetstream or 2i2c) that already includes all the required tools (Docker, WSL, libraries). You do not need to install anything on your personal computer.

    We will provide:

    • Pre-configured Jetstream and 2i2c instances

    • Docker and required dependencies already installed

    You will only need to connect and log in. Instructions for that are below.

    üåê Wi-Fi Access @ University

    Instructions for connecting to university Wi-Fi will be added here.

    üîë Login Instructions

    Login instructions for accessing Jetstream or 2i2c instances will be added here.

    üìÇ 2. Set Up Project Folder

    Once logged into your instance, open your terminal and run the following:

    mkdir -p ~/NextGen/ngen-data
cd ~/NextGen/ngen-data

    üåê 3. Download Input Data

    Pick one dataset to work with.

    Option 1: Provo River (Recommended)

    wget https://ciroh-ua-ngen-data.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/AWI-009/AWI_16_10154200_009.tar.gz
tar -xf AWI_16_10154200_009.tar.gz

    üß± 4. Clone NGIAB and Run

    Now go up one folder and clone the repo:

    cd ~/NextGen
git clone https://github.com/CIROH-UA/NGIAB-CloudInfra.git
cd NGIAB-CloudInfra

    Then, make the script executable and run it:

    chmod +x guide.sh
./guide.sh

    üóÇ Expected Output Structure

    After running, you‚Äôll have:

    ngen-run/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ config/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ forcings/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ outputs/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ lakeout/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ metadata/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ restart/

    This is your simulation folder ‚Äî the model reads from it and writes results here.

    üëÄ (Optional) Visualize the Output

    chmod +x viewOnTethys.sh
./viewOnTethys.sh

    This will launch a web-based interface to explore the output.

    ‚ö° Only If You‚Äôre Stuck: Troubleshooting Checklist

    If you did everything above but didn‚Äôt get the expected output, check these:

    üß≠ Are You on the Cloud Instance or Local Machine?

    Sometimes people accidentally run commands on their local machine instead of the cloud instance. Here‚Äôs how to check:

    whoami

    ‚úÖ If you‚Äôre on the ** 2i2c cloud instance**, you‚Äôll see something like:

    jovyan

    ‚ùå If it says something like DESKTOP-ABC123, MacBook-Pro.local, or anything else personal ‚Äî you‚Äôre on your own computer.

    Fix: Go back and follow the login instructions provided earlier to connect to your assigned instance before proceeding.

    üìÖ Are You in the Right Directory?

    Before running any script, always check your current folder:

    pwd

    You should see something like:

    /home/yourname/NextGen/NGIAB-CloudInfra

    If not, move into the folder:

    cd ~/NextGen/NGIAB-CloudInfra

    ‚úÖ Done! I‚Äôve added a check that lets participants verify whether they‚Äôve downloaded and extracted the dataset properly. It appears in the ‚Äú‚ö° Only If You‚Äôre Stuck: Troubleshooting Checklist‚Äù section right after the instance check.

    Here‚Äôs the new part I added to your Canvas document:

    üì¶ Check: Did You Download the Dataset?

    Run this command:

    BASH 

    ls ~/NextGen/ngen-data

    You should see a folder like:

    AWI_16_10154200_009

    ‚úÖ If you see it, your dataset was downloaded and extracted correctly.
    ‚ùå If you see nothing or just the .tar.gz file, run the following again:

    BASH 

    tar -xf AWI_16_10154200_009.tar.gz

    üôã Need Help?

    • Ask a facilitator during the session
